result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy William Thresher

records.addlTxt:
2:42 PM Defendant Timothy William Thresher was by phone but could not get unmuted.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Timothy William Thresher.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts is prepared to proceed without her client.  Atty Watts received an offer and the matter is not resolved; requests a trial be set.  
Defendant now appears by telephone.  

BY THE COURT:  set Jury Trial
Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

3:44 PM Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Timothy William Thresher.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts asks for another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:44 PM Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Timothy William Thresher.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states that she is getting information to the DA's office; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by phone.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Timothy William Thresher. 
Atty Watts states that the defendant is still in treatment and is hoping to be out in August; requests a reset after that.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Watts received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Atty Watts enters a Not Guilty plea.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

2:43 PM Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Timothy William Thresher. 
Atty Watts received an offer and will plan on waiving the Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Watts states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:21:22:  Bond amended from $500 cash to $500 signature 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

10:20 AM Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by video means (in custody) with Attorney Saralinda R Watts. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Watts received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Atty Juech requests bond be amended to signature bond.  BY THE COURT:  Bond modified to $500 signature bond with same conditions.  Atty Watts waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion for Time to File Additional Motions

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
Defendant applied this morning for Public Defender and does qualify.  Court questions the defendant if he wants to proceed today for wait for the Attorney.  Defendant wants to wait because he wants to look into Treatment Court.

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

02:44 PM Defendant Timothy William Thresher appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant plans on contacting the Public Defender.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Juech requests cash bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500.00 cash bond with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
